HIT SINGLE.Definition: popular song that became well-liked quickly

COUNTLESS.Definition: too many to be counted, numerous

PUBLIC FIGURES.Definition: people who are well-known in society

EXCLUSIVE.Definition: limited to a select group, not open to everyone

SLIP OF THE TONGUE.Definition: mistake in speaking, saying the wrong word by accident

UNIFORM.Definition: a set of clothing that everyone is required to wear

TOP HAT.Definition: formal hat with a tall, flat crown

RATIONING.Definition: controlling and limiting the distribution of goods during difficult periods

TAILS.Definition: long, back parts of a formal jacket

STARCHED.Definition: made stiff with starch (a substance used in laundry)

COLLAR.Definition: the part around the neck of a piece of clothing

ARISTOCRAT.Definition: person of the upper class in society, often associated with nobility

IMPRESS.Definition: make a strong impact or effect

WITH OPEN ARMS.Definition: In a very welcoming and accepting manner

OBSTACLE.Definition: something that blocks or hinders progress

CONTRADICTIONS.Definition: statements or ideas that conflict with each other

CONTRADICTION.Definition: statement or idea that conflicts with another

TABLOIDS.Definition: small sized newspapers that cover popular stories

PRIVILEGE.Definition: advantage or benefit of a certain group

MERITOCRATIC.Definition: based on ability or merit rather than social class

AMBITIOUS.Definition: having a strong desire for success or achievement

IN THE GRAND SCHEME OF THINGS.Definition: in the larger or overall perspective

ELITE.Definition: richest, most powerful group in a society

RECITING.Definition: repeating something from memory, like a poem or verse

PREDECESSOR.Definition: someone who held the position or role before the current person

ON MERIT.Definition: based on his abilities or achievements rather than social class

PEEK.Definition: have a quick look or glance
